stories.text:
It’s happened to me that I apply for a position at a company, get rejected and then apply again a few months/years later for a similar job at the same company.

In the interval, I update and tweak my CV or profile and I get better at interviewing.

Do companies/hiring managers/HR drones see your previous attempts and past interview notes when you apply again because hiring software cross references your previous applications with your name/email, or is every candidate starting with a clean slate unless they say they applied before and the person puts extra effort into finding the previous application?

And if it’s cross referenced, do the previous interview notes have any weight in the new application round?

I understand every company does this differently but I’d like to get a general sense whether this is common or not.
stories.title: Ask HN: When you apply again at a company, is your profile cross referenced?
Inspired by the Future: Vision UI Dashboard React Pro

stories.text:
I started Trade Blotter (tradeblotterapp.com) in 2017 after I struggled compiling risk and performance metrics across my many trading accounts. Five years later it’s still not launched.

Like many people working on side projects I’ve worked on it in fits and starts. I really want to launch it and could use some help finishing the backend, some front end and UX work and deploying. It has a Flask backend with a no-framework Bootstrap-based front end. There are some complexities with data acquisition and integrations.

How and where have people asked and received help for their side projects?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to get help for side projects?
